hints.content:
We can think of subtraction as:

$\blueE{\text{ part}} = \maroonD{\text{total}} - \goldE{\text{part}}$

We can relate subtraction to addition:

$\maroonD{\text{total}} = \blueE{\text{part}} + \goldE{\text{ part}}$

So, we can add $\blueE{14}$ to $\goldE{65}$ to find the $\maroonD{\text{total}}$.

![](web+graphie:${☣ LOCALPATH}/images/be750f5e9b42df1bac08e18354642afd73f5cfd3)

question.content:
**What number makes this equation true?**  
*Hint: Use the place value blocks to help solve.*

$14=$ [[☃ numeric-input 1]] ${}- 65$  

![](web+graphie:${☣ LOCALPATH}/images/827868a0fa528d5e9e0b25ddaab4beffcd799315)
